activities.name: Informed consent
activities.description: Obtain written informed consent from participant

activities.name: Admit to unit
activities.description: Participants will be admitted to the clinical research unit (CRU)

activities.name: Discharge from unit
activities.description: Discharge from the unit may occur after completion of all procedures and after the Investigator has reviewed all safety assessment

activities.name: Outpatient visit or phone call
activities.description: A single outpatient visit or phone call and safety laboratory assessment

activities.name: Inclusion/exclusion
activities.description: Assessment of inclusion and exclusion criteria

activities.name: Discuss/document contraception
activities.description: Discuss and document contraception requirements

activities.name: Follicle-stimulating hormone (post-menopausal females only)
activities.description: If needed to confirm menopause

activities.name: Alcohol test
activities.description: Alcohol test

activities.name: Urine drug screen
activities.description: Urine drug screen

activities.name: HIV, hepatitis B and C screen
activities.description: HIV, hepatitis B and C screen

activities.name: Medical history/demographics
activities.description: Parameters include age and sex. Race and ethnicity will be collected where permitted by local regulations.

activities.name: WD history
activities.description: Wilson disease history will include diagnosis date, method of diagnosis, history of cirrhosis, details of any previous liver biopsies performed, and treatment received

activities.name: Prior WD treatment
activities.description: Prior Wilson disease treatment history

activities.name: Physical examination
activities.description: A full physical examination will be performed at Screening, at check-in for the study, and at the End of the study/Early Termination Visit

activities.name: Height, weight, and BMI
activities.description: Height at screening only, weight and BMI measurements

activities.name: Enrollment/inclusion
activities.description: Enrollment and inclusion into the study

activities.name: Discontinue chelation therapy
activities.description: Discontinue chelation therapy

activities.name: Discontinue zinc therapy
activities.description: Discontinue zinc therapy

activities.name: ALXN1840 15 mg/day
activities.description: Administration of ALXN1840 at a dose of 15 mg/day

activities.name: ALXN1840 30 mg/day
activities.description: Administration of ALXN1840 at a dose of 30 mg/day

activities.name: Study intervention compliance
activities.description: During the outpatient period, participants will use SMS text messaging to confirm study intervention administration

activities.name: Blood sampling for PK: Plasma total Mo and PUF-Mo
activities.description: Blood sampling for PK/PD will occur before ALXN1840 administration and represents a predose trough

activities.name: PD: Plasma total and PUF-Cu, LBC, ceruloplasmin, ceruloplasmin-bound Cu
activities.description: Pharmacodynamic blood sampling for plasma total and PUF-Cu, LBC, ceruloplasmin, ceruloplasmin-bound Cu

activities.name: Chemistry, hematology, Coagulation
activities.description: Samples for serum chemistry will be obtained following a fast of at least 8 hours at the Screening Visit and at check-in

activities.name: Urinalysis
activities.description: Urinalysis

activities.name: Urine/serum pregnancy test
activities.description: Women of childbearing potential should only be enrolled after a negative serum pregnancy test result at Screening

activities.name: Retained serum sample (safety)
activities.description: A single 15 mL serum sample will be retained for evaluation in the event of an unexpected safety finding

activities.name: Vitals sign measurements
activities.description: Vital signs measurements should be performed predose. Vitals signs include body temperature, heart rate, respiratory rate, and systolic and diastolic blood pressure

activities.name: 12-lead ECG (triplicate)
activities.description: 12-lead ECG (triplicate) should be performed predose

activities.name: Adverse events
activities.description: Adverse events monitoring

activities.name: Cu/Mo-controlled meals
activities.description: Copper- and molybdenum-controlled diet will be initiated after registration/inclusion

activities.name: Light exercise regimen
activities.description: Light exercise regimen

activities.name: Urination and bowel movement monitoring, menstruation check
activities.description: Menstruation check is for women only

activities.name: 24-hour urine for Cu and Mo
activities.description: For each input/output balance period, 24-hour urine samples are to be collected for measurement of copper and molybdenum

activities.name: Feces for Cu and Mo
activities.description: For fecal samples, each individual sample will be independently collected with record of date, time, and weight of the sample

activities.name: Concomitant medication and non-pharmacologic therapy/procedure
activities.description: Concomitant medication and non-pharmacologic therapy/procedure

notes.text: a Within 42 days of ALXN1840 administration. Details of procedures that may be performed by sites designated as "screening sites" (only in the US) are detailed in Section 8.
b Participants will be admitted to the clinical research unit (CRU) at least 10 hours prior to enrollment and initiation of copper- and molybdenum-controlled diet.
c At the CRU's discretion, participants may remain in the CRU or be readmitted on Day 22 with all procedures starting on Day 23.
d Unscheduled study visits may occur at any time during the study and may include any study procedure as deemed necessary by the Investigator.
e Participants are required to return to the CRU Day 54+/-2; participants will be discontinued from ALXN1840 medication by their physician at the latest by the Day 54 follow-up.

f Discharge from the unit may occur after completion of all procedures on Day 9 and on Day 40 and after the Investigator has reviewed all safety assessment (including safety laboratory tests) and confirmed that the participant is appropriate for discharge.

g A single outpatient visit or phone call and safety laboratory assessment should occur between Day 14 and Day 18. A phone call may take place on a different day than the blood draw within the Day 14 through Day 18 period.
h If needed to confirm menopause.
i Parameters include age and sex. Race and ethnicity will be collected where permitted by local regulations.
j Wilson disease history will include diagnosis date, method of diagnosis, history of cirrhosis, details of any previous liver biopsies performed, and treatment received.
k A full physical examination will be performed at Screening, at check-in for the study, and at the End of the study/Early Termination Visit.
l Height at screening only.

m While in the CRU, study intervention will be administered after an overnight fast (ie, at least 10 hours) at the same time every morning; drug is to be administered with 240 mL of water and meals should be delayed a minimum of 2 hours after dosing.
n During the outpatient period, participants will use SMS text messaging to confirm study intervention administration.
o Blood sampling for PK/PD will occur before ALXN1840 administration and represents a predose trough.
p PK/PD collection will include timepoints described in the schedule of PK/PD assessment for Days 1, 25, 29, and 39.
q Samples for serum chemistry will be obtained following a fast of at least 8 hours at the Screening Visit and at check-in.
r Laboratory assessment including chemistry, hematology, and coagulation parameters should be performed on Days -8, -1, 8, 23, and 28 only.
s Menstruation check is for women only; women of childbearing potential should only be enrolled after a negative serum pregnancy test result at Screening.
t A single 15 mL serum sample will be retained for evaluation in the event of an unexpected safety finding.
u Vital signs measurements and ECGs should be performed predose, unless otherwise specified.
v Copper- and molybdenum-controlled diet will be initiated after registration/inclusion.
w For each input/output balance period, 24-hour urine samples are to be collected for measurement of copper and molybdenum.
x For fecal samples, each individual sample will be independently collected with record of date, time, and weight of the sample.
